c1236fb1-798f-42d2-9186-6e23eeacd444.name: Sympathy
c1236fb1-798f-42d2-9186-6e23eeacd444.notes: Death of one party reduces the other to 0 HP

2031b9be-9733-4a65-815a-693f85515c25.name: Sympathy
2031b9be-9733-4a65-815a-693f85515c25.notes: Death of one party reduces the other to 0 HP and wounds affect ally but not you

bd6e4d37-e90a-46ec-9543-06041bc205da.name: Sympathy
bd6e4d37-e90a-46ec-9543-06041bc205da.notes: Death of one party kills the other

b20a8a86-29a3-4e15-868c-2281b4d721c1.name: Sympathy
b20a8a86-29a3-4e15-868c-2281b4d721c1.notes: Death of one party kills the other and wounds affect ally but not you

73e8fdb6-f265-4014-91b1-4a3c314c7c03.name: Cultural Familiarity (any)
73e8fdb6-f265-4014-91b1-4a3c314c7c03.notes: Do not suffer the normal -3 penalty for unfamiliarity

955fa84f-ce43-47a8-aa48-860ee557a30d.name: Cultural Familiarity (any)
955fa84f-ce43-47a8-aa48-860ee557a30d.notes: Do not suffer the normal -3 penalty for unfamiliarity

92b40c98-fd58-4887-ae6c-087f9dcfa183.name: People Affected
92b40c98-fd58-4887-ae6c-087f9dcfa183.notes: Almost everyone except @large class of people@

features.situation: to rolls for any lengthy mental task you concentrate on to the exclusion of other activities, if the GM feels such focus would be beneficial
to all rolls to notice interruptions while obsessed with a task

527b072e-3c2b-414e-8733-2e831a341c55.name: Alternate Benefit
527b072e-3c2b-414e-8733-2e831a341c55.notes: Bonus to resist deception involving numbers

features.situation: on any task that requires creativity or invention, including most rolls against Artist skill and all Engineer rolls for new inventions

222fbf5a-305f-43c9-92d3-0c0002f639a9.name: Absent-Mindedness
222fbf5a-305f-43c9-92d3-0c0002f639a9.notes: Once adrift in your own thoughts, you must roll against Perception-5 in order to notice any event short of personal physical injury

features.situation: to all IQ and IQ-based skill rolls, save those for the task you are currently concentrating on

1a48a55b-a42c-482d-a691-0ed726812c37.name: Acrophobia (Heights)
1a48a55b-a42c-482d-a691-0ed726812c37.notes: You may not voluntarily go more than 15 feet above ground, unless you are inside a building and away from windows. If there is some chance of an actual fall, self-control rolls are at -5.

a0e65998-2b20-4da1-8547-df68ff87ed9b.name: Agoraphobia (Open Spaces)
a0e65998-2b20-4da1-8547-df68ff87ed9b.notes: You are uncomfortable whenever you are outside, and actually become frightened when there are no walls within 50 feet.

0f5c0fbe-5b39-45ba-829b-907199e689e6.name: Aichmophobia/TL6+ (Sharp Things)
0f5c0fbe-5b39-45ba-829b-907199e689e6.notes: You are afraid of anything pointed. Swords, spears, knives, and needles all give you fits. Trying to use a sharp weapon, or being threatened with one, requires a self-control roll at -2.

f01dcb9e-221f-4ae7-a780-317840977681.name: Ailurophobia (Cats)
f01dcb9e-221f-4ae7-a780-317840977681.notes: This includes all felines: lions, tigers, panthers, etc.

6b8a87d9-0b3a-4032-8dc1-4f9daf7d63b5.name: Autophobia (Being Alone)
6b8a87d9-0b3a-4032-8dc1-4f9daf7d63b5.notes: You cannot stand to be alone, and do anything in your power to avoid it.

3bb9bcb7-34b8-4af1-bada-afebf2e8bc57.name: Brontophobia (Loud Noises)
3bb9bcb7-34b8-4af1-bada-afebf2e8bc57.notes: You avoid any situation where loud noises are likely. A sudden loud noise requires an immediate self-control roll. A thunderstorm is a traumatic experience for you!

e2d8968f-f119-4cd1-900d-53d0830fe94e.name: Claustrophobia (Enclosed Spaces)
e2d8968f-f119-4cd1-900d-53d0830fe94e.notes: You are uncomfortable any time you can’t see the sky – or at least a very high ceiling. In a small room or vehicle, you feel the walls closing in on you... You need air! This is a dangerous fear for someone who plans to go underground.

25e8d142-6b5b-47ef-96d4-e1075c14bc8b.name: Code of Honor (Professional)
25e8d142-6b5b-47ef-96d4-e1075c14bc8b.notes: Adhere to the ethics of your profession; always do your job to the best of your ability; support your guild, union, or professional association.

5fe59d87-8c49-4b22-b9d5-1cb460027194.name: Coitophobia (Sex)
5fe59d87-8c49-4b22-b9d5-1cb460027194.notes: You are terrified by the idea of sexual relations or the loss of your virginity.

3ac60a31-2ed8-4d75-8324-04cddbf5a2d8.name: Curious
3ac60a31-2ed8-4d75-8324-04cddbf5a2d8.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with an interesting item or situation

58f3ed9c-8092-4e9b-ab96-6e4ad3a868f7.name: Cynophobia (Dogs)
58f3ed9c-8092-4e9b-ab96-6e4ad3a868f7.notes: This includes all canines: foxes, wolves, coyotes, wild dogs, etc.

49339459-4c6c-4bbe-bdc2-696fd8d94c63.name: Demophobia (Crowds)
49339459-4c6c-4bbe-bdc2-696fd8d94c63.notes: Any group of over a dozen people sets off this fear unless they are all well known to you. The self-control roll is at -1 for over 25 people, -2 for a crowd of 100 or more, -3 for 1,000, -4 for 10,000, and so on.

58b053cb-5fe4-40cc-b533-8c0d961bb146.name: Entomophobia (Insects)
58b053cb-5fe4-40cc-b533-8c0d961bb146.notes: You are afraid of all “bugs.” Large or poisonous ones give -3 to self-control rolls. Very large ones, or large numbers, give -6. Avoid hills of giant ants.

e81f17d2-2cdb-4358-9182-04f513aec09e.name: Hemophobia (Blood)
e81f17d2-2cdb-4358-9182-04f513aec09e.notes: The sight of blood gives you the screaming willies! You need to make a self-control roll during most combats...

9fcd0b15-f048-439f-b4d9-3a6ab73b8ff7.name: Herpetophobia (Reptiles)
9fcd0b15-f048-439f-b4d9-3a6ab73b8ff7.notes: You come unglued at the thought of reptiles, amphibians, and similar scaly slimies. A very large reptile, or a poisonous one, gives -2 to self-control rolls; a horde of reptiles (such as a snake pit) gives -4.

67923c56-7b89-4bcf-807f-1671c40f713c.name: Honesty
67923c56-7b89-4bcf-807f-1671c40f713c.notes: Make a self-control roll when faced with the “need” to break unreasonable laws; if you fail, you must obey the law, whatever the consequences. If you manage to resist your urges and break the law, make a second self-control roll afterward. If you fail, you must turn yourself in to the authorities!

9ca9b0b3-e692-41d0-aa4b-d96e299d804a.name: Hoplophobia (Weapons)
9ca9b0b3-e692-41d0-aa4b-d96e299d804a.notes: The presence of any sort of weaponry is stressful. Trying to use a weapon, or being threatened with one, requires a self-control roll at -2.

features.situation: from victims of your intolerance (may be as much as -5, at GM's discretion)
toward those you are jealous of (may be as much as -4, at GM's discretion)

ecd91f80-3179-4b97-934a-6cfffaa14d6a.name: Manaphobia (Magic)
ecd91f80-3179-4b97-934a-6cfffaa14d6a.notes: You can never learn to use magic, and you react badly to any user of magic. Make a self-control roll whenever you are in the presence of magic. This roll is at -3 if you are to be the target of friendly magic, and -6 if you are the target of hostile magic. (The magic does not have to be real, if you believe in it!)

bbba71af-ced3-4a2f-b8ac-ba923829711d.name: Mysophobia (Dirt)
bbba71af-ced3-4a2f-b8ac-ba923829711d.notes: You are deathly afraid of infection, or just of dirt and filth. Make a self-control roll when you must do something that might get you dirty. Roll at -5 to eat any unaccustomed food. You should act as “finicky” as possible.

f9c84ec9-614e-4e1c-a7d6-64e6cd8d90fa.name: Necrophobia (Death)
f9c84ec9-614e-4e1c-a7d6-64e6cd8d90fa.notes: You are terrified by the idea of death. Make a self-control roll in the presence of any dead body (animals don’t count, but portions of human bodies do). Roll at -4 if the body is that of someone you know, or -6 if the body is unnaturally animated in some way. A ghost (or apparent ghost) also requires a roll at -6.

features.situation: from others in any situation where No Sense of Humor becomes evident
to resist Influence skills: Diplomacy, Fast-Talk, Intimidation, Savoir-Faire, Sex Appeal, and Streetwise

8f20e13b-16b1-4d8a-9bb6-4cef2ae761fd.name: Obsession
8f20e13b-16b1-4d8a-9bb6-4cef2ae761fd.notes: varies; Make a self-control roll whenever it would be wise to deviate from your goal. If you fail, you continue to pursue your Obsession, regardless of the consequences.

9c8380f9-4d5b-45f1-be1f-540973a5c8c3.name: Overconfidence
9c8380f9-4d5b-45f1-be1f-540973a5c8c3.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are

009a16e8-0aac-42e2-810c-8fb4f2750ea5.name: Pacifism: Cannot Harm Innocents
009a16e8-0aac-42e2-810c-8fb4f2750ea5.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may only use deadly force on a foe that is attempting to do you serious harm. Capture is not “serious harm” unless you are already under penalty of death or have a Code of Honor that would require suicide if captured. You never intentionally do anything that causes, or even threatens to cause, injury to the uninvolved – particularly if they are “ordinary folks.”

e21d7b9c-eef7-4ed3-a4fd-3babc7ee40cb.name: Pacifism: Cannot Kill
e21d7b9c-eef7-4ed3-a4fd-3babc7ee40cb.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may never do anything that seems likely to kill another. This includes abandoning a wounded foe to die “on his own”! You must do your best to keep your companions from killing, too. If you do kill someone (or feel responsible for a death), you immediately suffer a nervous breakdown. Roll 3d and be totally morose and useless for that many days. During this time, you must make a Will roll to offer any sort of violence toward anyone, for any reason.

60db4faa-548c-4819-a0d6-5fccd3a60496.name: Very Unfit
60db4faa-548c-4819-a0d6-5fccd3a60496.notes: You lose FP at twice the normal rate and recover FP at only half the normal rate

features.situation: -2 to all HT rolls to remain conscious, avoid death, resist disease or poison, etc.

30822f8c-ce63-46a7-acd3-b8df2199fe95.name: Pacifism: Reluctant Killer
30822f8c-ce63-46a7-acd3-b8df2199fe95.notes: You are psychologically unprepared to kill people. Whenever you make a deadly attack (e.g., with a knife or a gun) against an obvious person whose face is visible to you, you are at -4 to hit and may not Aim. If you cannot see the foe’s face (due to a mask, darkness, or distance, or because you attacked from behind), the penalty is only -2, save in close combat. You have no penalty to attack a vehicle (even an occupied one), an opponent you do not believe is a person (including things with Horrific or Monstrous appearance), or a target you can’t actually see (e.g., a set of map coordinates or a blip on a radar screen). If you kill a recognizable person, the effect on you is the same as for Pacifism: Cannot Kill. You have no problem with your allies killing; you may even supply ammo, loaded weapons, and encouragement! You just can’t do the killing yourself.

78b82fd1-81de-4f1d-8f58-904ecd0fd58b.name: Pacifism: Self-Defense Only
78b82fd1-81de-4f1d-8f58-904ecd0fd58b.notes: You only fight to defend yourself or those in your care, using only as much force as necessary (no pre-emptive strikes allowed!). You must do your best to discourage others from starting fights.

5ada4b50-a2e4-4d19-b174-9686d3e04cd4.name: Post-Combat Shakes
5ada4b50-a2e4-4d19-b174-9686d3e04cd4.notes: Make a self-control roll at the end of any battle. If you fail, roll 3d, add the amount by which you failed your self-control roll, and look up the result on the Fright Check Table.

60785831-d65d-4132-ac1d-79c5384dae72.name: Pyrophobia (Fire)
60785831-d65d-4132-ac1d-79c5384dae72.notes: Even a burning cigarette bothers you if it comes within five yards.

04a7710a-e1af-4a4b-8b1b-72615b8d92e1.name: People Affected
04a7710a-e1af-4a4b-8b1b-72615b8d92e1.notes: Almost everyone except @large class of people@

9cb1e062-10b1-4478-b1ce-6de319e3bda9.name: Scotophobia (Darkness)
9cb1e062-10b1-4478-b1ce-6de319e3bda9.notes: A common fear, but crippling. You should avoid being underground if possible; if something happens to your flashlight or torch, you might well lose your mind before you can relight it.

f154e8db-4c53-48f2-a184-64d3cc3f7320.name: Selfish
f154e8db-4c53-48f2-a184-64d3cc3f7320.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you experience a clear social slight or “snub.” On a failure, you lash out at the offending party just as if you had Bad Temper.

features.situation: from others when your Selfishness surfaces

269c935c-b335-4e87-bcc4-48281ad01658.name: Teratophobia (Monsters)
269c935c-b335-4e87-bcc4-48281ad01658.notes: Any “unnatural” creature sets off this fear. You have -1 to -4 on the self-control roll if the monster seems very large or dangerous, or if there are a lot of them. Note that the definition of “monster” depends on experience. An American Indian would consider an elephant monstrous, while an African pygmy would not!

0780734a-0cd9-4a69-828a-3d24ccb00f01.name: Thalassophobia (Oceans)
0780734a-0cd9-4a69-828a-3d24ccb00f01.notes: You are afraid of any large body of water. Ocean travel, or even air travel over the ocean, is basically impossible for you, and encounters with aquatic monsters are also upsetting.

13900fc8-8002-43a2-8b11-7a2f181dae6d.name: Triskaidekaphobia (Number 13)
13900fc8-8002-43a2-8b11-7a2f181dae6d.notes: You must make a self-control roll whenever you have to deal with the number 13. Roll at -5 if Friday the 13th is involved!

96f68200-6a2c-434e-a398-f8ff881cd6c3.name: Truthfulness
96f68200-6a2c-434e-a398-f8ff881cd6c3.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must keep silent about an uncomfortable truth (lying by omission). Roll at -5 if you actually have to tell a falsehood! If you fail, you blurt out the truth, or stumble so much that your lie is obvious.

af8f5f50-d404-4710-8762-bee4329b0ec0.name: Unluckiness
af8f5f50-d404-4710-8762-bee4329b0ec0.notes: Once per play session, the GM will arbitrarily and maliciously make something go wrong for you.

46864043-1692-4e1d-94c1-70f86b50a072.name: Xenophobia (Strange and Unknown Things)
46864043-1692-4e1d-94c1-70f86b50a072.notes: You are upset by any sort of strange circumstances, and in particular by strange people. Make a self-control roll when surrounded by people of another race or nationality; roll at -3 if the people are not human. If you lose control, you might well attack strangers out of fear.

1b0b926e-59e5-4185-8738-4c7758c04ce9.name: Spend 3 extra points in primary or secondary skills
